intro: Pilosella glaucescens subsp. marginalis, commonly known as the marginal pilosella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered with fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
